tagged_story_for_tts:
Random—

The universe’s oldest dice roll, a whisper of chaos stitched into the fabric of order. It is the flicker of a dying bulb in an empty corridor, the way raindrops choose which leaves to kiss first. A glitch in the matrix, a coin flip where heads and tails dissolve into quantum foam. Randomness is the laughter of gods too bored to script fate, the static between radio stations tuning into parallel worlds.

It lives in the scatter of pigeons startled by nothing, in the way tea leaves settle into prophecies no one asked for. The stock market’s nervous heartbeat, the shuffle of a deck that remembers every hand it’s ever dealt. A snowflake’s defiance—no two alike, yet all surrendering to the same gravity.

Random is the algorithm’s blind spot, the place where patterns unravel into pure, unapologetic chance. The roll of a die that lands on its edge. The name drawn from a hat that wasn’t yours. The neuron firing just because. It is both the birthplace of miracles and the graveyard of meaning, a force that hums beneath every carefully laid plan: You thought you were in control? Then it grins, and the wind changes direction.
